messageBody:
Lily,

Maybe I missed something from earlier in this thread,
but I'm not sure why you *want* the inVAJava() call to
return true when you're outside of VAJ. I'm not a VAJ
user but a quick look at the sources for Junit 3.8.1
suggests that the only thing this method really
controls is some automatic class reloading behavior.

As your test program shows, inVAJava() is *correctly*
answering that it is not running in VAJ when you're
outside of VAJ. It would seem to me that instead of
finding a way to have more of VAJ present, you'd be
looking to *not* have com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport
present in your classpath. If it wasn't there, the
attempt to load it in inVAJava() will just report that
it isn't there rather than leaving you with problems
loading other clasess the DebugSupport appears to be
trying to load.

Rick

--- ok_lilya <lilya.jangirov@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>

> Class.forName("com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport");

> inVAJava() method

> try {
> Class.forName("com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport");
> }
> catch (Exception e) {

> return true;

>
> main... {
> if (inVajava())
> System.out.println("true");
> else

> }

> vative IBM java
> class.
